p: Jamaica is home to many established medicinal plants such as ginger, garlic, medina, ganja, cerasee, ball moss and fever grass [ 103]. This makes the island particularly welcoming for rigorous scientific research on the medicinal value of plants and the development of phytomedicine thereof. This could have great economic and medicinal implications, not only for Jamaica, but for the region. Our traditional use of these medicinal plants in Jamaica can be attributed to the passing of knowledge from traditional Asian and African medicine.
